body.content:
Upon starting the game, all participants draw an initial hand of 13 tiles. The turn sequence
is initiated by the East player and continues counter-clockwise.

For each turn, you shall draw one tile and discard one tile to end your turn. Your discarded tile
will be put in the Discards field. You can call on opponent's discarded tiles to steal them.

Chii is the call to complete a Sequence. You can Chii when the left player discarded a tile
that can form a Sequence with 2 tiles in your hand (Forming 7-8-9 Sou Sequence). Upon calling,
you shall open the Sequence formed on your side, then discard a tile from your hand.

Pon is the call to complete a Triplet. You can Pon when any player discarded a tile
that can form a Triplet with 2 tiles in your hand (Forming West Wind Triplet). Upon calling,
you shall open the Triplet formed on your side, then discard a tile from your hand.

Kan is the call to complete a Quad. Kan can be called on discarded tile
from any player. You can also make a Kan call when you have four identical tiles in your hand
(Closed Kan), or has a previously melded Triplet and then draw the fourth tile.

When your hand only need 1 more tile to win, and you have never called in this round,
you can call Riichi to bet 1000 point and wait for your winning tile
(You cannot change your hand during this).

When you're only waiting for your winning tile, if you draw it youself, you can
call Tsumo declaring you have won by self-drawn. The game
will end and you can see your score.

When you're only waiting for your winning tile, if an opponent discard that tile,
you can call Ron declaring you have won by stealing the winning tile. The game
will end and you can see your score.
